title: Finance minister to renew funds to Palestinians in Israel after backlash
description: Israeli Finance Minister Smotrich said the money was prompting crime among Palestinian communities, triggering outrage.

title: Are climate reparations finally on the way for vulnerable countries?
description: 'Significant change in action' under way to compensate nations under direct assault from climate chaos, observers say.

title: What will replace Russia’s Wagner mercenary army?
description: Private force is already being torn apart by Russia's military, intelligence services, and state-run corporations.

title: A Palestinian Bedouin’s fight to reunite with her children in Israel
description: Agzaya al-Karan had been forced to return to Gaza for the first time in 30 years three weeks ago.

title: ‘Slow murder’: Hundreds of prisoners stage Bahrain’s largest hunger strike
description: Advocates say that prisoners are protesting against dire conditions – and that the government's reforms are not enough.

title: France abaya ban: ‘How far will clothes police go?’
description: To enforce the ban on the robes in classrooms, 14,000 educational personnel will be trained by the end of the year.

title: Will Ethiopia compromise on its Grand Renaissance Dam?
description: Addis Ababa insists the dam will not harm its neighbours as another meeting is held with Egypt and Sudan.

title: Lionel Messi makes MLS debut, but how does the league work?
description: The MLS has different rules, including playoffs, that differ from the way other football leagues operate.

title: Hawaiian Electric pushes back on claims of negligence after Maui wildfires
description: Utility company rejects Maui County lawsuit accusing it of contributing to deadly blazes that tore through communities.

title: Iran says deal agreed with Iraq for disarming, relocation of Kurdish rebels
description: Tehran sets deadline of September 19 for rebels to be disarmed and removed from bases in northern Iraq.

title: UK air traffic issue fixed but flights remain affected
description: Air traffic authority says technical issue affected its system's ability to automatically process flight plans.

title: UK could fit asylum seekers with electronic tags
description: Home Secretary Suella Braverman says authorities need 'a power to detain and ultimately control those people'.

title: India to launch mission to study the sun in September
description: India's first solar probe to blast off after last week's successful moon touchdown, so it can study solar winds.

title: Trump indictments: Key court dates set in Georgia, federal election cases
description: Former US president will be arraigned in Georgia next week while judge sets March 2024 start for federal trial.

title: Rubiales case sparks hope for ‘seismic’ changes in Spanish football
description: Experts say the case can help transform Spanish women's football and broader society, but deeper changes are needed.

title: How useful will the F-16s be in helping Ukraine?
description: Ukraine is increasingly looking to replace its jets as Russia continues to dominate the skies in the 18-month-long war.

title: DeSantis urges Florida residents to prepare for incoming storm Idalia
description: Strengthening in Caribbean, storm is expected to hit US state's Gulf of Mexico coast this week as 'major hurricane'.

title: Gabon: French media hit by ban, internet down, in disputed election
description: Reporters Without Borders also denounced the fact that foreign media was largely restricted from covering the vote.

title: Spanish prosecutors open sexual assault probe into Rubiales over kiss
description: Prosectors to investigate the Spanish football federation chief after his forcible kiss of player Jenni Hermoso.

title: Rights groups condemn Taliban’s new curbs on women’s education, movement
description: Watchdogs slam Taliban for blocking women from boarding a flight to study in Dubai and from visiting a national park.

title: French envoy to stay in Niger despite ultimatum, says Macron
description: Macron insists that France will not change its position in condemning the coup and offering support to Bazoum.

title: Iran’s Raisi inaugurates South Pars gasfield after foreign companies exit
description: Raisi says the project has been completed years ahead of plan and saved a lot of money by transporting an existing rig.

title: ‘Like being inside an oven’: Extreme weather batters imprisoned people
description: As climate change makes extreme temperatures more frequent, many US prisons lack resources to address safety needs.

title: Who was Dmitry Utkin, a key Wagner mercenary who died alongside Prigozhin?
description: The secretive war-hardened career-officer-turned-mercenary is said to have given the Wagner group its name.

title: Sudan’s RSF floats ‘peace plan’ as rival army chief eyes regional trip
description: The RSF's proposals for ethnic diversity come amid widespread reports of ethnic cleansing and sexual violence in Darfur.

title: Japan summons China ambassador over Fukushima ‘harassment’ calls
description: The move comes after flood of nuisance calls from China to local businesses following release of water from the plant.

title: Rubiales’s mother goes on hunger strike to protest ‘bloody hunt’ on son
description: The Spanish football chief's mother says her hunger strike would last until the 'hunt' against her son is over.

title: Panama’s doomsday warning is not about holiday shopping
description: The nation is where the climate crisis, the refugee crisis and the inequalities of capitalism intersect.

title: How Martin Luther King’s ‘Dream’ speech almost didn’t happen
description: Prompted by an audience member, the civil rights leader improvised the most famous part of his “I Have a Dream” speech.

title: Acai berry craze boosts incomes in the Brazilian Amazon, but at a cost
description: Acai cultivation has boosted local economy but critics say expansion of acai palms causing a loss of biodiversity.

title: Monkey Man: Protecting rescued monkeys in the Peruvian Amazon
description: In the Peruvian Amazon, a man in his 70s faces leaving the monkeys he’s dedicated his life to protecting.

title: Typhoon Saola lashes northern Philippines as it heads for Taiwan
description: The typhoon which dumped heavy rains across northern Philippines is now moving towards Taiwan and southern China.

title: Pakistani activist rearrested hours after bail in sedition case: Lawyer
description: Imaan Mazari-Hazir's lawyer says police did not share details of new charges which came after court granted bail to her.

title: Donald Trump campaign raises more than $7m by selling mugshot merchandise
description: Donation haul underscores how Trump's legal woes have been a fundraising boon for his election campaign.

title: Iraq offers rewards for information on missing people from Gulf War
description: Baghdad calls on people with information about burial sites of missing persons from the Gulf War to come forward.

title: Will Denmark ban the burning of the Quran?
description: Country is moving to make the burning of holy books illegal.

title: France to ban wearing abaya dress in schools: Minister
description: Move comes after months of debate over wearing of abayas in French schools, where women are banned from wearing hijab.

title: ISIL doubled territory it controls in Mali in less than a year: UN
description: UN experts say the group now controls rural areas in eastern Menaka and large parts of the Ansongo area in northern Gao.

title: Wagner boss Yevgeny Prigozhin confirmed dead in crash
description: Genetic analysis confirms mercenary boss was killed after his aircraft went down in what appeared to be an explosion.

title: Q&A: Sebastien Lai on father Jimmy Lai’s Hong Kong ‘show trial’
description: The media tycoon has been in jail for three years awaiting trial under the territory's national security law.

title: Russia-Ukraine war: List of key events, day 551
description: As the war enters its 551st day, these are the main developments.

title: Simone Biles wins record 8th US gymnastics title, a decade after her first
description: The four-time Olympic gold medallist broke the record for most all-around titles for a man or woman.

title: Indonesia’s absence from bigger BRICS echoes decades of non-aligned policy
description: Indonesian President Joko 'Jokowi' Widodo has said he does not want to 'rush' membership of the economic grouping.

title: Zimbabwe opposition alleges ‘blatant and gigantic fraud’ in election
description: Nelson Chamisa says opposition will challenge outcome as President Emmerson Mnangagwa denies any fraud.

title: Foxconn billionaire Terry Gou announces Taiwan presidential bid
description: Gou will run as an independent after losing the race to be the candidate for the opposition Kuomintang.

title: Biden says ‘no place’ for white supremacy in US after Florida racist attack
description: Hundreds gather for prayer vigils as three Black victims of Jacksonville shooting named.

title: South Korea’s seafood sellers reel as science fails to ease Fukushima fears
description: More than 90 percent of South Koreans say they will reduce their seafood consumption due to radiation concerns.

title: Papua New Guinea to open Israel embassy in Jerusalem
description: PNG will join handful of nations operating from city whose status is at the core of the Israeli-Palestinian conflict.

title: Row at India’s premier private university sparks debate on academic freedom
description: Ashoka University is accused of stifling academic freedom after it distances itself from a research paper on 2019 polls.

title: US commerce secretary visits China, calls for ‘stable’ ties
description: Gina Raimondo says 'profoundly important' for two biggest economies to have a stable relationship.

title: Aleppo airport out of service after Israeli air attack: State media
description: Israeli attack damages runway, grounding flights in northern Syria, state news agency SANA reports.

title: Palestine’s betting on BRICS, but is BRICS betting on Palestine?
description: BRICS is pushing for direct talks between Israel and Palestine. But its members don't want to alienate Israel.

title: Libya protests after foreign minister reportedly met with Israeli official
description: Najla al-Mangoush's meeting with Israeli counterpart in Rome led to street protests in several Libyan cities.

title: India’s Neeraj Chopra, Pakistan’s Arshad Nadeem make javelin history
description: Chopra is the first Indian to win gold and Nadeem first Pakistani to win medal at the World Athletics Championships.

title: ‘Hi Mom’: Stolen at birth, man reunited with Chilean mother after 42 years
description: Jimmy Lippert Thyden was kidnapped at birth by hospital workers during the rule of dictator Augusto Pinochet.

title: World Athletics: Ukraine’s Mahuchikh wins gold, Dutch ‘steal’ women’s relay
description: Mahuchikh, who fled the Russian bombardment of her native city of Dnipro last year, wins gold in women's high jump.

title: Four dead, 18 rescued after boat sinks off Greek island of Lesbos
description: The survivors, who have been transported to the port of Mytilene in Lesbos, included Yemenis, Palestinians and Somalis.

title: Saudi Arabia appoint Italy’s Roberto Mancini as national team coach
description: Mancini, who led Italy to Euro 2020 title but failed to take them to Qatar World Cup, had earlier quit as Azzurri boss.
